item.description:
Ok, let's try this again... This Sunday's hike will be at Salmon River Park in Colchester!  Thanks again to Todd & Pat for their leadership in picking this one out...Just to let everyone know that the first part of the hike is pretty much straight uphill, then levels off.  And depending on how everyone feels we can do the loop through Day Pond, or head back.


NOTE: This hike will be at the covered bridge side.


This Park Map - Shows the Gulf Rd. parking area: DON'T PARK THERE !!!!

http://www.ct.gov/deep/lib/deep/stateparks/maps/slmn.pdf

 

DEP Website for Salmon River State Forest:

Click Here


Directions

Google Maps:  http://maps.google.com/maps?q=Comstock+Bridge+Rd,+East+Hampton,+CT&hl=en&sll=41.500765,-72.757507&sspn=1.565385,2.375793&oq=comstock+bridge+rd&hnear=Comstock+Bridge+Rd,+East+Hampton,+Middlesex,+Connecticut+06415&t=m&z=16

From the Norwich area: take Route 2 west, Exit 18. Follow Route 16 west for 6.2 miles; turn RIGHT onto Comstock Bridge Rd.

From the New London area: follow Route 11 north onto Route 2 west, Exit 18. Follow Route 16 west for 6.2 miles. Turn right onto Comstock Bridge Rd.

From the Middletown area: follow Route 66 east onto Route 16. Follow Route 16 east for 5.5 miles. Turn left onto Comstock Bridge Rd.

From the Hartford area: take Route 2 east, Exit 16. Follow Route 149 south for 3.2 miles. Turn right onto Route 16 west. Follow Route 16 west for 1.9 miles. Turn right onto Comstock Bridge Rd..
item.how_to_find_us: Fred will be there in his blue rickshaw.
item.name: Salmon River State Forest Hike
